keyTakeAways: Lindsey Halligan, a Trump-appointed interim US Attorney, has fired multiple senior prosecutors from the Eastern District of Virginia, including Beth Yusi and Kristin Bird, citing alleged leaks of unauthorized information to the press.
The firings reflect a growing conflict between Halligan and experienced career prosecutors who opposed the prosecution of political figures like James Comey and Letitia James.
This pattern of personnel changes follows earlier resignations and firings, including that of Maggie Cleary, who was a senior Justice Department prosecutor and opposed the Comey indictment.
Michael Ben’Ary and Maya Song were also fired after the Comey indictment, and Troy Edwards Jr. resigned, indicating widespread dissent among career prosecutors.
Halligan has taken an unusually active role in courtroom proceedings, which is atypical for a US attorney and suggests a personal, politically driven approach to prosecution.

The situation reflects a broader conflict over political accountability versus national security, with some prosecutors asserting that the Justice Department is prioritizing political retaliation over legal and national security concerns.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In October 2025, Lindsey Halligan, a Trump-appointed interim US Attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia, has fired several senior prosecutors, including Beth Yusi and Kristin Bird, citing allegations of unauthorized leaks to the press. This move follows a broader pattern of resignations and firings, including those of Maggie Cleary, Michael Ben’Ary, Maya Song, and Troy Edwards Jr., all of whom opposed the politically charged prosecution of James Comey and Letitia James. Halligan’s active involvement in courtroom proceedings and her dismissive actions signal a deepening conflict between political appointees and career prosecutors who argue the office is prioritizing political retaliation over national security. The situation reflects growing internal dissent and raises concerns about the integrity and independence of the Justice Department in politically sensitive cases.
title: Lindsey Halligan fires more prosecutors in key US attorney’s office
